universum.studios.android.ui.widget

Class EditLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.FrameLayout
          • universum.studios.android.ui.widget.FrameLayoutWidget
            • universum.studios.android.ui.widget.InputLayout
              • universum.studios.android.ui.widget.EditLayout
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable.Callback, AccessibilityEventSource, KeyEvent.Callback, ViewManager, ViewParent, ErrorWidget, Slideable, Widget, WidgetGroup

    public class EditLayout
extends InputLayout
    Implementation of InputLayout to provide input container for EditText component. All features supported by InputLayout are also supported by this layout. By default, EditLayout creates full view hierarchy on its initialization with label, note, edit text and constraint views that will be laid out as described in InputLayout class overview. Whether to show or hide some of these views can be requested by specifying desired input features via InputLayout.requestInputFeatures(int).

    EditText set up

    EditText of EditLayout can be accessed via getInputView() method. EditLayout implements only necessary delegate methods to perform base set up of its input view like setting its hint text via setHint(CharSequence) or its input type via setInputType(int).

    XML layout

    As described in InputLayout class overview in the same section, also EditLayout can be used within an Xml layout. The following sample shows Xml layout structure with different usages: 
     <LinearLayout
      xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
      xmlns:ui="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
      android:layout_width="match_parent"
      android:layout_height="match_parent">

      <!-- Default usage. -->
      <universum.studios.android.ui.widget.EditLayout
              android:layout_width="match_parent"
              android:layout_height="wrap_content"/>

      --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

      <!-- Layout with custom EditText. -->
      <universum.studios.android.ui.widget.EditLayout
              android:layout_width="match_parent"
              android:layout_height="wrap_content">

              <EditText
                      android:layout_width="match_parent"
                      android:layout_height="wrap_content"
                      ui:uiInputChildType="input"/>

      <universum.studios.android.ui.widget.EditLayout>

      --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

      <!-- Layout with all custom views. -->
      <universum.studios.android.ui.widget.EditLayout
              android:layout_width="match_parent"
              android:layout_height="wrap_content"
              ui:uiWithEmptyViewHierarchy="true">
              <!--
                  uiWithEmptyViewHierarchy="true"
                  This flag ensures that the EditLayout will be initialized with the empty view
                  hierarchy so we can supply the custom one.
              -->

              <!-- Label view. -->
              <TextView
                      android:layout_width="wrap_content"
                      android:layout_height="wrap_content"
                      ui:uiInputChildType="label"/>

              <!-- Input view. -->
              <EditText
                      android:layout_width="match_parent"
                      android:layout_height="wrap_content"
                      ui:uiInputChildType="input"/>

              <!-- Below views are optional. =========================================== -->

              <!-- Note view. -->
              <TextView
                      android:layout_width="wrap_content"
                      android:layout_height="wrap_content"
                      ui:uiInputChildType="note"/>

              <!-- Constraint view. -->
              <TextView
                      android:layout_width="wrap_content"
                      android:layout_height="wrap_content"
                      ui:uiInputChildType="constraint"/>

      <universum.studios.android.ui.widget.EditLayout>
 <LinearLayout>

    XML attributes

    See InputLayout, EditLayout Attributes

    Default style attribute

    uiEditLayoutStyle
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky
    See Also:
    SpinnerLayout

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EditLayout(Context context)
      Same as EditLayout(android.content.Context, android.util.AttributeSet) without attributes.
      EditLayout(Context context, AttributeSet attrs)
      Same as EditLayout(android.content.Context, android.util.AttributeSet, int) with R.attr#uiEditLayoutStyle as attribute for default style.
      EditLayout(Context context, AttributeSet attrs, int defStyleAttr)
      Same as EditLayout(android.content.Context, android.util.AttributeSet, int, int) with 0 as default style.
      EditLayout(Context context, AttributeSet attrs, int defStyleAttr, int defStyleRes)
      Creates a new instance of EditLayout for the given context.

      Returns the current length constraint requested for the EditText of this input layout.

      Returns the maximum length (in characters) applied to the current EditText.

      Delegate method for TextView.getMaxLines().
      int getMinLines()
      Delegate method for TextView.getMinLines().
      CharSequence getText()
      Like getEditableText() but this method will return the text specified for this edit layout via android:text attribute if the current input view of this layout is not valid.
      protected boolean onAnimateLabel(TextView labelView, boolean show)
      Invoked whenever a change in the text within EditText occurs and hint view should be showed or hided by animation.

      Invoked whenever a change in the text of EditText occurs.

                  int defStyleRes)

        Parameters:
        context - Context in which will be the new view presented.
        attrs - Set of Xml attributes used to configure the new instance of this view.
        defStyleAttr - An attribute which contains a reference to a default style resource for this view within a theme of the given context.
        defStyleRes - Resource id of the default style for the new view.

      • setMaxLength

        public void setMaxLength(int maxLength)
        Sets the maximum length (in characters) to be used as constraint filter for the current EditText. Setting this property will constraint a user in typing more characters into EditText than the specified value.

        Note, that if none zero, this value will also change the current value of length constraint requested by setLengthConstraint(int) used to indicate current state of the editable text's length vs. the constraint one.

        Parameters:
        maxLength - The desired maximum length. Passing 0 will clear the current filter.
        See Also:
        android:maxLength, getMaxLength()

      • getMaxLength

        public int getMaxLength()
        Returns the maximum length (in characters) applied to the current EditText.
        Returns:
        Maximum length or 0 by default.
        See Also:
        setMaxLength(int)

      • setLengthConstraint

        public void setLengthConstraint(int lengthConstraint)
        Sets the value of length constraint used when indicating the current editable text's length vs. the constraint length to show to a user how many more characters can be inputted into EditText yet. This state will be shown within the constraint view added by InputLayout.addConstraintView(TextView) at the right bottom part of this layout.

        Note, that unlike setMaxLength(int), setting this property will not constraint the user in typing more characters into EditText than the specified value. This constraint has only informational character.

        Parameters:
        lengthConstraint - The desired length constraint. Passing 0 will clear the current constraint text within the constraint view.
        See Also:
        ui:uiLengthConstraint, getLengthConstraint()

      • getLengthConstraint

        public int getLengthConstraint()
        Returns the current length constraint requested for the EditText of this input layout.
        Returns:
        Length constraint or 0 by default.
        See Also:
        setLengthConstraint(int)

      • validateInputView

        protected boolean validateInputView(@NonNull
                                    View view)
        Description copied from class: InputLayout
        Called whenever some of addView(...) methods is called upon this input layout to validate if the specified view can be input view for this input layout.
        Overrides:
        validateInputView in class InputLayout
        Parameters:
        view - The view to be validated for input view.
        Returns:
        True to add the given view into this layout as input view by InputLayout.addInputView(android.view.View), false to add as regular view.

      • onEditableChanged

        protected void onEditableChanged(@NonNull
                                 CharSequence editable)
        Invoked whenever a change in the text of EditText occurs.

        This implementation will handle this change based on the enabled features (InputLayout.FEATURE_LABEL, InputLayout.FEATURE_CONSTRAINT, ...) by showing/hiding the label view and updating current text length vs. constraint length.

        Parameters:
        editable - Current editable value presented within EditText.

      • onInputFeaturesChange

        protected void onInputFeaturesChange(int features)
        Description copied from class: InputLayout
        Invoked whenever InputLayout.requestInputFeatures(int) is called upon this layout and the specified features has been changed.
        Overrides:
        onInputFeaturesChange in class InputLayout
        Parameters:
        features - The changed input features.

      • onAnimateLabel

        protected boolean onAnimateLabel(@NonNull
                                 TextView labelView,
                                 boolean show)
        Invoked whenever a change in the text within EditText occurs and hint view should be showed or hided by animation.

        This implementation uses animations provided by R.attr#uiFloatingLabelAnimationIn and R.attr#uiFloatingLabelAnimationOut obtained from the style set to this view or from Xml layout file.

        Parameters:
        labelView - Label text view to be animated. If showing, this text view already contains the current hint from EditText.
        show - True if label view should be showed, false to be hided.
        Returns:
        True if label view was showed/hided by animation, false if it should be showed/hided just by changing its visibility flag.

      • onEditFocusChange

        protected void onEditFocusChange(boolean focused)
        Invoked whenever focus of the edit text contained within this edit layout has changed.

        By default this edit layout activates/deactivates here its label view.
